p: Regarding the perceived causes of climate change, 32% of the respondents identified human activity as the main driver, 50% identified a combination between human activity and natural patterns, and 15% attributed the causes to natural patterns only ( Fig 3a). Again, political view was the main predictor of the responses to this question, with respondents from the left and center-left being more inclined to identify human activity as the main driver of climate change (~ 65%) than other respondents (~ 20%) ( Fig 3b).
